Description.val:
This budget line item supports Physiological Episodes (PE) starting in FY 2019. PE is a continuation of efforts previously funded in BLI 0525 F/A-18 Series and BLI 0569 T-45 Series. Oxygen System Upgrades incorporates Aircrew Oxygen System related modifications to all USN/USMC fixed wing aircraft.

This line item funds Aircraft Integration Modifications for the Enhanced Visual Acuity (EVA) program for USN/USMC Rotary Wing and Tilt Rotor Aircraft and Aircrew Oxygen System related modifications for Physiological Episode (PE) program for fixed wing aircraft. This line item will also be utilized for future Aviation Life Support Modifications as required.

Current aviation life support equipment (ALSE) flight vests worn by HMLA aircrew have excessive bulk which can impede the performance of precision mission tasks.  HQMC Aviation has a requirement for a modular aviator body armor vest (ABAV) system capable of being configured for specific airframes (UH-1Y, AH-1Z) that operate over land and water.

Justification.val: FY 2021 funds are requested to incorporate modifications which address the alarming increase in Physiological Episodes (hypoxia and decompression sickness events).

Name.@footnote: The production seat kits have an automatic actuation which is a pre-product improvement for future automatic capability.  The input signal has not been identified yet and anticipated to be an ECP for the seat.
Support funding for labor and anticipated ECP/s to the EEOS production kits.
FY19 delivery and FY20 and FY21 contract and deliveries dates adjusted to reflect manufacturing delay.

Description.val:
Oxygen System Upgrades incorporates Aircrew Oxygen System related modifications to all USN/USMC fixed wing aircraft.  Oxygen systems include On-Board Oxygen Generation System (OBOGS), On-Board Inert Gas Generation System (OBIGS), regulators, Oxygen Storage Bottles, and Naval Aircrew Common Ejection Seats (NACES) kits.

Current modifications address the alarming increase in Physiological Episodes (hypoxia and decompression illness events). This is the #1 Commander, Naval Air Force (CNAF) priority and Chief of Naval Air Training (CNATRA) Safety Issue. OBOGS hardware improvements have been qualified to address aging system deficiencies and are being fielded.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Contractor Field Team:: Installation Name: Enhanced Visual Acuity

Description.val: Enhanced Visual Acuity (EVA) is a digital replacement for the AN/AVS-9 Aviator Night Vision goggles for all USN/USMC Rotary Wing and Tilt Rotor Aircraft.  The system will provide increased resolution under reduced light levels and serve as the display for aircraft Heads Up Display (HUD) systems.  APN-5 funding will be utilized for aircraft modifications required to provide electrical power and HUD symbology for the EVA system.

Current aviation life support equipment (ALSE) flight vests worn by HMLA aircrew have excessive bulk which can impede the performance of precision mission tasks. HQMC Aviation has a requirement for a modular aviator body armor vest (ABAV) system capable of being configured for specific airframes (UH-1Y, AH-1Z) that operate over land and water. The areas of improvement are intended to produce a modular equipment system that focuses on mission tailoring, enhanced survivability, and enhanced mobility while reducing weight, bulk, and heat stress.
